p: Further, we compared spike glycoprotein (S) protein of Wuhan-Hu-1-CoV, SARS-CoV and MERS-CoV ( Figure S4). It was observed that during the viral infection, S protein underwent several drastic changes. The S protein of Wuhan-Hu-1-CoV was more prone to mutations; particularly, the amino acid sequence represented ~19% alteration with four major insertions and ~81% homology in contrast to SARS ( Table 1, Figure 4a,b). Additionally, we found that the Wuhan-Hu-1-CoV S protein was vulnerable to mutations, especially in spike protein-cell receptor interface-associated amino acids.
